qas.question: What did Jobs state that he expected Macintosh to become?
How many applications were widely available during Macintosh's introduction?
How many companies did Apple promise were develping products for the new computer?
How many Macintoshes had Apple sold after one year?
How many databases did Apple have available the first year?
What did Gates state that he expected Macintosh to become?
How many applications were widely unavailable during Macintosh's introduction?
How many companies did Microsoft promise were develping products for the new computer?
How many Macintoshes had Microsoft sold after one year?
How many databases did Apple have available the last year?

context: Jobs stated during the Macintosh's introduction "we expect Macintosh to become <a0_0><b5_0>the third industry standard<b5_0/><a0_0/>", after the Apple II and IBM PC. Although outselling every other computer, it did not meet expectations during the first year, especially among business customers. <a1_0><b6_0>Only about ten<b6_0/><a1_0/> applications including MacWrite and MacPaint were widely available, although many non-Apple software developers participated in the introduction and Apple promised that <a2_0><b7_0>79<b7_0/><a2_0/> companies including Lotus, Digital Research, and Ashton-Tate were creating products for the new computer. After one year, it had less than one quarter of the software selection available compared to the IBM PC—including only one word processor, <a4_0><b9_0>two<b9_0/><a4_0/> databases, and one spreadsheet—although Apple had sold <a3_0><b8_0>280,000<b8_0/><a3_0/> Macintoshes compared to IBM's first year sales of fewer than 100,000 PCs.
